text: I can see why, but you're in a great condition with the unconditional offer from Kingston... so you should hopefully have the choice once you've finished your exams - and plenty of time to think it through before then :+1:
How do you feel about the offer from Westminster? Do you think you can get the grades they require?
So you're finished? When do you find out how you did?

Regarding business - it's a bit of a mix. I'm actually taking a lot of time to work on a completely different project, so I can step back from the interview coaching to focus my efforts on that a little bit more. However, I'm relatively practical about my approach to the interview business - I have a list of tasks to complete and set about prioritising them and working through one by one. I also allow previous clients to "interrupt" my break, since it's often less work / effort to support people I worked with in the past and helpful to keep revenue from drying up. Does that all make sense?

Yes, I might firm Kingston as my first choice because the lecturers there seemed great and a lot of current students mentioned great things about them and the uni as a whole (with their bad experiences too). 
Westminster was a little more demanding and they seem strict, I’m aiming for B’s but if I really push myself I think I should be able to get those grades (if I work hard everyday)!!

I get my mock results in the beginning of April, I think these exams were much better than the November ones and I can really see myself making progress which is good. Hopefully my grades reflect this.

Yes it made sense, and that is a great approach to your work! 
You organise your time and tasks well, I struggle at prioritising my important work because I get so carried away trying to complete my smaller tasks..
